intro: Ah, Good day, Herr General!  Please sit down  and allow me to explain the present situation.  The Spanish Nationalists have requested the help of Germany to wrest control of Spain from their enemies. In leading this expedition, you will have the opportunity to sharpen your skills in the art of war. You will test the General Staff's new ideas regarding tank use, concentration of force, and combined arms operations.  Your expertise can then be put to work towards the real objective:  the return of Germany to its proper place,  the leader of Europe.

briliant.text: My commendations, Herr General!  Under harsh conditions, you have done very well!  Your complete victory has shown that already you have gained valuable experience in this new type of warfare.  In addition, the new pro-German government in Spain will prove to be a useful ally in the coming years.

lose.text: I am aware that conditions have been harsh, but you have done poorly!  The only positive result is that you and your troops have gained some experience in this new type of armored warfare.   But, the new Spanish government and our other allies have not yet learned to respect our military capabilities which we require!   Herr General, do not disappoint us again.

tactical.text: Herr General, your narrow victory has shown that already you have gained some experience in this new type of warfare.  In addition, the new pro-German government in Spain may prove to be a useful ally in the coming years.

victory.text: Well Herr General, despite harsh conditions, you have done quite well!  Your victory has shown that already you have gained valuable experience in this new type of warfare.  In addition, the new pro-German government in Spain may prove to be a useful ally in the coming years.

intro: Herr General, you must break through and encircle the enemy along the Polish frontier, exploiting their lack of mobility.  We will send pre-emptive strikes to destroy the Polish air force, therefore no aircraft will impede your advance.  Speed is essential; a successful advance here will allow us to threaten Warsaw from the north and east simultaneously.  In addition, we can welcome our Soviet friends to the key city of Brest-Litovsk on the new German-Soviet border.  The General Staff will not be pleased if it is the Soviets who welcome us instead.

briliant.text: Herr General!  Very good work!  The crisis is over, and the Polish Army has collapsed.  Once you led us past the river, nothing could stop our panzers.  Congratulations.

lose.text: Your less than spectacular performance has motivated a reevaluation of your usefulness.   Some of the enemy has retreated into Romania.  The British and French have now declared war on Germany.  If we did not need every man to fight, your career would be over!

tactical.text: Herr General. The crisis is over, and the Polish Army has collapsed.   Unfortunately, some of the enemy has retreated into Romania.  No doubt, we will encounter these tough and vengeful troops again.  There are other repercussions as well.  The British and French have now declared war on Germany.

victory.text: Herr General!  Good work!  The crisis is over, and the Polish Army has collapsed.  Once you led us past the river, nothing could stop our panzers.  Congratulations.

intro: The Soviet Union has invaded Finland, Herr General, and our Finnish friends have trapped a Soviet division in the town of Suomussalmi. Unfortunately, an even greater Soviet relief force is moving to aid their comrades, and the Finns are outnumbered. It is your task to destroy the isolated enemy and prevent the relief force from reaching him. Of course, due to our non-aggression pact with the Soviet Union, you and your troops will be considered volunteers.  If you are defeated, the General Staff will deny any knowledge of your participation, and you may expect the worst if captured.

briliant.text: Herr General, your bold and energetic tactics have allowed us a complete victory.  And now the Finnish people have been given the will to face the Soviets with us in future campaigns.  Well done!

lose.text: You were fortunate to have escaped capture after the fiasco you perpetrated in Finland.  However, your previous performance merits another opportunity.  Do not fail us again.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Herr General, your bold and energetic tactics have allowed us a complete victory.  Finland is still a nation and now a valuable ally.  Good work, Herr General!

intro: Herr General, our initial drives into Belgium and the Netherlands have been quite successful. Your task is to drive into the southern Netherlands and seize the important Philips industrial plant at Eindhoven.  Speed is essential.

briliant.text: Herr General, your speed in attaining your objectives was outstanding.  The Philips plant was been taken almost undamaged!  The General staff is pleased with your performance and has assigned you a key role in our French campaign.

lose.text: You have failed miserably.  With the loss of our surface fleet, England remains dominant on the high seas. Report for reassignment immediately!

tactical.text: You have succeeded in your mission where many others would have failed.  However, the Western Allies have been able to evacuate a majority of their troops and sink most of our surface fleet.

victory.text: Herr General, your speed in attaining your objectives was outstanding.  The Philips plant was been taken almost undamaged!  The General staff is pleased with your performance and has assigned you a key role in our French campaign.

intro: Herr General, your victory at Lillehammer allows us an opportunity to crush our old enemy, France.  Their army is said to be the world's finest.  We shall see!  Now, we believe the Allies plan to push into Belgium in response to our offensive.  Your task is to lead your forces through the Ardennes and emerge behind the enemy.  Our victory at Sedan in 1870 made Germany a Great Power.  Your victory at Sedan will return us to that status.

briliant.text: Superb work, Herr General!  Thanks to your rapid advance across the Meuse, the Allies are in complete disarray.  You have demonstrated the superiority of our tactics over what was once called the world's best army.  We must now push rapidly to the shores of the English Channel and complete the defeat of our enemies.

lose.text: Your failure is beyond comprehension.  The enemy armies have escaped encirclement and already have begun to counterattack.  The General Staff has no need for incompetent commanders.

tactical.text: You have accomplished your mission, but your lack of speed has allowed the enemy armies to escape.  It is possible that the campaign against the British and French could go on as long as the last war.  Herr General, we will, no doubt, call on you again for your services.

victory.text: Superb work, Herr General!  Thanks to your rapid advance across the Meuse, the Allies are in complete disarray.  You have demonstrated the superiority of our tactics over what was once called the world's best army.  We must now push rapidly to the shores of the English Channel and complete the defeat of our enemies.

intro: Well, following your success at Sedan, your brave men must now capture the port of Dunkirk on the Channel.  Allied forces in Belgium will be trapped if we can secure this harbor.  With the British Army as prisoners, we can dictate peace on our terms.  Of course, the English are aware of this possibility and will fight  furiously to protect their lines of retreat.  Good luck to you.

briliant.text: You have captured the British Expeditionary Force, and the French have surrendered.  You have achieved a great victory, Herr General.

lose.text: Herr General, German field commanders are not allowed to fail. Do you understand? I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: You have won, Herr General. You have crippled the British Expeditionary Force, and the French have surrendered. Unfortunately, the English continue to resist us even after the loss of their contemptible, little army. Good work.

victory.text: You have achieved a Great Victory, Herr General. You have crippled the British Expeditionary Force, who had to abandon almost all of their equipment.  The Belgians have surrendered, so now the French have to fight alone. Very good.

intro: The defeat of the British Expeditionary Force struck a severe blow to the morale of the French.  A swift thrust towards Paris will undoubtedly further demoralize them and should lead to their swift surrender.

briliant.text: Very good work, Herr General.  Your swift thrust towards Paris has again demonstrated that our Blitzkreig is superior to the static defences of the French.  They have surrendered!

lose.text: Your failure is beyond comprehension.  The enemy armies have escaped encirclement and already have begun to counterattack.  The General Staff has no need for incompetent commanders.

tactical.text: You have accomplished your mission, but your lack of speed has allowed the enemy armies to escape.  It is possible that the campaign against the British and French could go on as long as the last war.  Herr General, we will, no doubt, call on you again for your services.

victory.text: Very good work, Herr General.  Your swift thrust towards Paris has again demonstrated that our Blitzkreig is superior to the static defences of the French.  They have surrendered!

intro: Herr General, our postponement of our invasion of Norway proved most fruitful.  As our intelligence believed, the British did invade in order to cut off the shipments of Swedish iron ore through Norway to us.  As a result Norway and Sweden are now co-belligerents with us, though not allies.  The Norse and Swedes have proved much tougher than the British expected, especially with the support of our Luftwaffe.  The British have been halted and forced back to the vicinity of the port of Narvik.  Now the time has come to drive the British from Norway.

briliant.text: Herr General, once again you have done well.  The British have been driven from Norway.  Next you shall take a well-deserved leave while your men rest and resupply in southern France. You will undoubtedly have an important role in our spring 1941 operations.

lose.text: Herr General, German field commanders are not allowed to fail. Do you understand? I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Herr General, once again you have done well.  The British have been driven from Norway.  Next you shall take a well-deserved leave while your men rest and resupply in southern France. You will undoubtedly have an important role in our spring 1941 operations.

intro: Ah, Herr General.  Excuse me, Herr Feldmarschall.  A bold stroke to invade England is necessary.  We must force the Allies to the bargaining table so that we may have the peace needed to develop the Fatherland to its full glory.  You have been given command of the initial phase of the invasion.

briliant.text: Superb performance, Herr Feldmarschall! Our troops are safely ashore in England.  You have helped accomplish what Napoleon could not - the invasion of England!

lose.text: Herr General, you have failed.  The British have successfully withdrawn.  We expected more from you.  Dismissed.

tactical.text: The English have withdrawn, and Greek resistance has collapsed.   Your performance has been adequate.  Thank you, Herr General.

victory.text: Superb performance, Herr Feldmarschall! Our troops are safely ashore in England.  You have helped accomplish what Napoleon could not - the invasion of England!

intro: Well, our forces have stormed ashore on England's beaches only to meet ferocious resistance.  Our drive to capture London has been stalled.  Now, your services are needed to capture Windsor, a vital communications center.  With this rail junction in our hands, London will be cut off from their industrial centers and be forced to surrender.  Good luck, Herr General.

briliant.text: Congratulations, Herr General!  You have accomplished what has not been done for centuries, the conquest of England.  Now, the English have no choice but to sue for peace.  I can assure you that your name shall be remembered alongside the greatest heroes of our nation.  I salute you, Herr General!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Well, you barely accomplished your mission, but the conquest of England is the positive result.  Now, the English will have no choice but to sue for peace.  You have been lucky, Herr General, with this narrow victory.

victory.text: Congratulations, Herr General!  You have accomplished what has not been done for centuries, the conquest of England.  Now, the English have no choice but to sue for peace.  I can assure you that your name shall be remembered alongside the greatest heroes of our nation.

intro: The General Staff has decided that you should lead the attack against the British in North Africa.  Their will to fight has by no means been broken.  If we can push the English out of North Africa, we will gain access to the Suez Canal and the oil-rich Middle East.

briliant.text: Congratulations, Herr General.  Your aggressive leadership has shattered the British forces. Now, we must capture the port of Tobruk, before the English can prepare an effective defense.

lose.text: Thanks to your feeble efforts, the war in North Africa will continue to drag on.  You will return immediately to Germany to face a court martial. Your replacement here will be Herr General Rommel.  You are dismissed.

tactical.text: You have pushed the British back, but they have managed to withdraw into their Tobruk fortress.  Unfortunately, we do not have the resources to capture Tobruk at this time.  The war in the desert will continue.  Herr General, you are to return to Germany immediately.

victory.text: Your leadership has shattered the British forces.  Congratulations, Herr General.  Now, we must capture the port of Tobruk before the English can prepare an effective defense.

intro: Herr General, you must quickly crush the defenses of Tobruk and finish what you have so successfully begun.  If Tobruk falls into our hands, the British will never recover.  Now is our chance to drive them into the sea.

briliant.text: Congratulations!  The General Staff is pleased by your performance.  Egypt and the Middle East lie at our feet. Herr General, you have exceeded all expectations. Your mastery of the art of war continues to dismay our enemies.

lose.text: Herr General, you have disgraced the Wehrmacht with your conduct of this battle!  Many here demand your return to Berlin to face a court-martial.  Your services will no longer required.

tactical.text: Well, Herr General, you have managed to take Tobruk after a hard fight, but the English were still able to withdraw and strengthen their forces in Egypt.  Unfortunately, the war in North Africa will continue to drag on, since we lack the resources to sustain a major effort in the desert.

victory.text: Well, The General Staff is pleased by your performance.  Egypt and the Middle East lie at our feet.  Your ability on the battlefield continues to confound our enemies.

intro: For far too long, the English based on Malta have interrupted our flow of supplies to North Africa.  You have been selected to lead an elite assault force and subdue this enemy stronghold.  You must secure all the island's harbors and airfields so that our hold on the Mediterranean is secure.

briliant.text: Your successful capture of Malta has secured our position in the Mediterranean basin.  The English will trouble us no longer, and the entire area is under our control.  You are to be congratulated.  Excellent work!

lose.text: German field commanders are not allowed to fail.  I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: Your successful capture of Malta has secured our position in the Mediterranean basin.  The English will trouble us no longer, and the entire area is under our control.  Good day, Herr General.

victory.text: Your successful capture of Malta has secured our position in the Mediterranean basin.  The English will trouble us no longer, and the entire area is under our control.  You are to be congratulated.

intro: General, welcome to the East. Let me brief you. The government in Berlin has finally decided that it is time to destroy our sworn enemies - the Bolsheviks. Your attack here at Brest-Litowsk will be the opening hour of Operation Barbarossa. Along a front line 3000km long, guns will open fire. The enemy should be completely surprised and you'll be able to cross the Bug river with almost no resistance. Good luck all the same!

briliant.text: Well done General! You captured your objectives quickly. Our advance into southern Russia and the Ukraine is going as planned. We can now help our Romanian allies deal with the Soviet occupation force in Moldavia.  The General staff has decided that you will lead the drive to capture Kishinev.

lose.text: Herr General. Even now, enemy troops are advancing on our position.  Arm yourself with a rifle and seek redemption on the front lines. You may leave at once.

tactical.text: General? Do you realise the results of your failed attack? We are far behind the schedule! You had better not do something like this again. You are getting one last chance to redeem yourself, here in the south. Go!

victory.text: Well done General! You captured your objectives quickly. Our advance into southern Russia and the Ukraine is going as planned. We can now help our Romanian allies deal with the Soviet occupation force in Moldavia.  The General staff has decided that you will lead the drive to capture Kishinev.

intro: Herr General, as you know, Germany has declared war on the Soviet Union.  You have been chosen to play a key role in our drive into southern Russia. You will assist our Romanian Allies in their attempt to reclaim their lost province of Moldavia. The key city in this province is Kishinev, and it is also your primary objective.  Not only is this assignment strategically important, it is politically critical.  The world is watching, Herr General, do not disappoint.

briliant.text: Herr General, this victory is worthy of great praise. The southern front is now secure, and, more importantly, the Ukraine with its rich resources is ours.  It is my pleasure to inform you that your request for leave has been granted.  Berlin is beautiful in the summer.  Enjoy yourself.

lose.text: Herr General. Even now, enemy troops are advancing on our position.  Arm yourself with a rifle and seek redemption on the front lines. You may leave at once.

tactical.text: Herr General, Kishinev is secure. German and Romanian troops are occupying the Ukraine.  This victory is worthy of great praise. Soon, you will be needed at Army Group North.

victory.text: Herr General, Kishinev is secure. German and Romanian troops are occupying the Ukraine.  This victory is worthy of great praise.  Soon, you will be needed at Army Group North. I am sure that you will do very well.

intro: Herr General,  it is your privilege to lead our attack here, south of Novgorod, in the Russian heartland.  A successful offensive here will sever communications between Moscow and Leningrad and trap several Soviet armies. It is, of course, imperative to take your objectives quickly.  Our thoughts are with you.

briliant.text: Excellent. The Bolshevik armies are cut off without hope of relief.  And, even now,  communication between Moscow and Leningrad has been severed.  Leningrad should now fall easily; Moscow will be more problematic.

lose.text: Colonel Schmidt?  Please, come in.  You have heard the news?  Maybe it is best that he did not return from Novgorod.  After all, the shame of utter defeat would have been too much for him to bear.  A slice of strudel Colonel Schmidt?

tactical.text: A  good performance, to be sure. The Bolshevik armies are cut off without hope of relief.  And, even now,  communication between Moscow and Leningrad has been severed.  Leningrad should now fall easily; Moscow will be more problematic.

victory.text: A  good performance, to be sure. The Bolshevik armies are cut off without hope of relief.  And, even now,  communication between Moscow and Leningrad has been severed.  Leningrad should now fall easily; Moscow will be more problematic.

intro: Herr General, our drive on Moscow has been quite successful, but enemy resistance continues to stiffen.  You must break through along the Volokolamsk Highway.   There is no doubt; the enemy will commit his toughest units to defend the capital, but we will persevere.

briliant.text: Herr General, you have exceeded our expectations.  The enemy fought valiantly, but this did not stop you.  And now, the last Bolshevik reserves await your attack.  Defeat them and end this war.

lose.text: This is a bitter defeat. Even now, enemy troops are advancing on our position.  Arm yourself with a rifle and seek redemption on the front lines.  I must leave you now, Herr General.

tactical.text: Herr General,  you narrowly accomplished what was expected of you.  Unfortunately, the Soviets held the Volokolamsk Highway long enough for more troops to arrive.  In addition, heavy snows are now falling.  Our offensive cannot continue under these conditions. Herr General, you are not suited to command at this level.  You will report to the officer training school at Metz. There is an opening for a panzer maintenance instructor.

victory.text: Herr General, the enemy fought valiantly, but this did not stop you.  And now, the last Bolshevik reserves await your attack.  Defeat them and end this war.

intro: Well,  Herr General, a bold stroke from the city of Klin to Fedoroloka will close the ring on Moscow. If we can drive through to this point, the enemy capital will surely be ours.  Good luck!

briliant.text: Superb  performance, Herr General! The Bolsheviks have fled to Siberia and sued for peace. You have helped accomplish what Napoleon could not -  the conquest of Russia!  Our panzers rumble through Red Square, and our troops sleep in the Kremlin!  Your reputation in war is unparalleled.

lose.text: Herr General, German field commanders are not allowed to fail. Do you understand?  I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: Herr General, though able to achieve some limited success, you did not show the initiative demanded of German field commanders.  You were expected to do more than merely follow orders. The Bolsheviks still defy us.

victory.text: Superb performance, Herr General!  Your victory completed our encirclement of Moscow, but the Bolsheviks still resist us!  Their fresh troops from Siberia managed to relieve Moscow, while our weary troops have gone into winter quarters.  We shall resume our campaign in the spring.  You and your brave men are being sent to the South for rest and resupply.

intro: Well, our forces have stormed ashore on England's beaches only to meet ferocious resistance.  Our drive to capture London has been stalled.  Now, your services are needed to capture Windsor, a vital communications center.  With this rail junction in our hands, London will be cut off from their industrial centers and be forced to surrender.  Good luck, Herr General.

briliant.text: Congratulations, Herr General!  You have accomplished what has not been done for centuries, the conquest of England.  Now, the English have no choice but to sue for peace.  I can assure you that your name shall be remembered alongside the greatest heroes of our nation.  I salute you, Herr General!

lose.text: Herr General, it may have been to your advantage to have remained in captivity. This failure was completely unexpected from an officer of your caliber and experience. Your services will no longer be required!

tactical.text: Well, you barely accomplished your mission, but the conquest of England is the positive result.  Now, the English will have no choice but to sue for peace.  You have been lucky, Herr General, with this narrow victory.

victory.text: Congratulations, Herr General!  You have accomplished what has not been done for centuries, the conquest of England.  Now, the English have no choice but to sue for peace.  I can assure you that your name shall be remembered alongside the greatest heroes of our nation.

intro: Ah, Herr General, I hope you have enjoyed your leave.  As you know, the British fortress of Gibraltar is a serious threat to our operations in the Mediterranean region.  With the conquest of France, and your victory in Norway, now is the time to eliminate this threat to our control of the Mediterranean.  We have persuaded Spain to join us and our ally Italy in our attack on Gibraltar.

briliant.text: Herr General, I must congratulate you on this brilliant success. Gibraltar is ours.  Of course, our ally Spain will be given nominal soverignty over Gibraltar, but it will serve us as our base.  You handled this difficult assignment well.  After some well-earned rest and recuperation you and your men will undoubtedly be called upon to play a key role in our 1941 spring campaign.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Gibraltar is ours, thanks mainly to the skill of Feldmarschall Kesselring in breaking through the defenses on the Spanish side.  Of course, our ally Spain will be given nominal soverignty over Gibraltar, but it will serve us as our base.  Herr General, you did not handle this difficult assignment with the skill you have shown in previous battles.  However, you will be given another chance.  After some rest and recuperation you and your men will probably be called upon to play a role in our 1941 spring campaign.

victory.text: Herr General, I must congratulate you on this brilliant success. Gibraltar is ours.  Of course, our ally Spain will be given nominal soverignty over Gibraltar, but it will serve us as our base.  You handled this difficult assignment well.  After some well-earned rest and recuperation you and your men will undoubtedly be called upon to play a key role in our 1941 spring campaign.

intro: Ah, Herr General, I hope you have enjoyed your leave.  As you know, British and Commonwealth troops have defeated our Italian allies in North Afrika and pushed them back into Italian colonial territory.  The General staff has decided to send aid to the Italians in the form of an Afrika Korps, commanded by Feldmarschall Rommel.  You and your men will serve under him.  His mission is to stop the British and then make a drive to the East.

briliant.text: Again Herr General, I must congratulate you on an outstanding success. The British have been stopped and sent reeling in retreat.  You handled another difficult assignment skillfully.  Now we must follow up on this initial success and pursue the British eastward. You will resume the attack as soon as fresh supplies and reinforcements can be brought up.

lose.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

tactical.text: The British have been stopped, mainly because of the brilliant manuevers of Feldmarschall Rommel.  You, Herr General, did not handle this difficult assignment at all well.  However, you will be given another chance.  You will serve under Feldmarschall Rommel in his drive towards the British stronghold of Tobruk.

victory.text: Again Herr General, I must congratulate you on an outstanding success. The British have been stopped and sent reeling in retreat.  You handled another difficult assignment skillfully.  Now we must follow up on this initial success and pursue the British eastward. You will resume the attack as soon as fresh supplies and reinforcements can be brought up.

intro: Herr General, we have underestimated the Bolsheviks' powers of resistance. They have crossed the Don and completely encircled Sixth Army. You must drive on Kletskaya and Serafimov to reestablish contact. We will never, never surrender to the Red Army, but in order for us to hold our position, you must prevail. Good Luck.

briliant.text: Congratulations, Herr General.  Your troops have successfully cleared a corridor to our comrades in Sixth Army. We will be able to continue to send reinforcements and supplies to our brave men.  Bravo.

lose.text: Herr General, this is a disaster! Sixth Army is entirely lost to us.  Though this situation is not totally of your making, your career is obviously finished. You are dismissed.

tactical.text: Congratulations, Herr General. Your troops have successfully cleared a corridor to our comrades in Sixth Army. We will be able to continue to send reinforcements and supplies to our brave men. Bravo.

victory.text: Congratulations, Herr General. Your troops have successfully cleared a corridor to our comrades in Sixth Army. We will be able to continue to send reinforcements and supplies to our brave men. Bravo.

intro: Herr General, as you know the Kursk Salient poses a serious threat to us. To reduce this salient and restore the integrity of our line, we will attack from the north and south, pocket, and then crush the enemy trapped inside. You and your command will lead the northern thrust of our offensive. You must penetrate as far as the town of Prokhorovka. Good Luck.

briliant.text: You have dealt the Red Army a crippling blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer a large number of  troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Superlative work, Herr General.

lose.text: Herr General, we have broken our teeth on the enemy defenses. The Bolsheviks are counterattacking all along our front. Army Group South has been shaken and must give ground. General Hoth will be assuming your duties. That is all.

tactical.text: You have dealt the Red Army a severe blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer some troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Good work, Herr General.

victory.text: You have dealt the Red Army a severe blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer some troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Good work, Herr General.

intro: Herr General, you already know that the enemy has launched an amphibious operation south of Naples, near Salerno. The terrain in this part of Italy is hilly and rugged, and we have been able to contain the enemy beachhead thus far. It is of critical importance that the Americans and British are not allowed to gain a foothold on the continent. We are relying on you and your crack troops to throw the enemy into the sea. Failure here is not an option.

briliant.text: Herr General, once again you and your courageous men have kept us from the brink of disaster. Italy remains firmly in our camp, and the invaders have been forced out of Salerno. The Fatherland owes you a great debt.

lose.text: Herr General, I am sorry that the sacrifices of your fine troops have been in vain. Italy has  capitulated to the Allies, and we must fall back quickly or face annihilation. You have been ordered to Berlin. I do not envy your reception there.

tactical.text: Herr General, once again you and your courageous men have kept us from the brink of disaster. The invaders have been forced out of Salerno. The Fatherland owes you a great debt.

victory.text: Herr General, once again you and your courageous men have kept us from the brink of disaster. The invaders have been forced out of Salerno. The Fatherland owes you a great debt.

intro: Ja Wolfgang, I was as surprised as you that they chose Normandy.... Ah, Herr General, come in. Allow me to explain the present situation. We have a chance to drive the Allies back into the sea, here, near Caen. I will not pretend that this will be an easy task, but you have shown yourself to be a most resourceful fellow time and time again, ja? You will need all your skill to wrest a victory here. Our thoughts are with you. Ja, As I was saying, Wolfgang....

briliant.text: Excellent! Despite the fact the enemy have managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. It is unfortunate that we do not have more like you, Herr General.

lose.text: Herr General, I am sorry that the sacrifice of your fine troops have been in vain.  You have been ordered to Berlin.  I do not envy your reception there.

tactical.text: Very good! Despite the fact the enemy has managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. You have done very well, Herr General.

victory.text: Very good! Despite the fact the enemy has managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. You have done very well, Herr General.

intro:
Herr General, we have an excellent opportunity to deliver a crushing blow to the enemy, here, north of Strasbourg. As you can see, the advance of the American Third Army has left this sector of
their front inadequately defended. If you can knife through to Strasbourg, the Americans and British will be forced to halt their drive on the Fatherland. Good luck.

briliant.text: Herr General, your thrust to Strasbourg will be used as a textbook example of offensive maneuver. This lightning blow has changed the course of the war in the west.  Outstanding.

lose.text: The Americans and British have pushed us back across the Rhine. We no longer have the strength to halt them. All that is left for the fatherland is defeat and disgrace. But you have already experienced that. Haven't you, Herr General?

tactical.text: Herr General, your thrust to Strasbourg will be used as a textbook example of offensive maneuver. This lightning blow, you have changed the course of the war in the west. Outstanding.

victory.text: Herr General, your thrust to Strasbourg will be used as a textbook example of offensive maneuver. This lightning blow, you have changed the course of the war in the west. Outstanding.

intro: Herr General, I know that you and your men have not had time even to catch a breath, but the situation here is critical. Buda-Pest is besieged by the Bolsheviks. Your troops must force their way into the city. It is doubtful that our Hungarian allies will continue to fight if Buda-Pest falls. If you can drive the Reds into the Danube, we may stop the Russian Bear from consuming us.

briliant.text: The Russians are dazed and reeling from the blows you and your brave men have delivered! Not only did you succeed in relieving Buda-Pest, you drove the Reds back across the Danube. Herr General, diplomatic representatives of Germany and the Soviet Union are meeting even as we speak... Your string of victories here, and in the west, are unparalleled. You are to return home to a grateful nation.

lose.text: It was hoped that you would once again snatch victory from defeat. But it was not to be. The Wehrmacht is a spent force, unable even to slow the Russian Bear.  I advise you to fight your way to the west, Herr General. The Reds are not known for their hospitality to guests.

tactical.text: Herr General, diplomatic representatives of Germany and the Soviet Union are meeting even as we speak... Your string of victories here, and in the west, are unparalleled.... You are to return home to a grateful nation.

victory.text: Herr General, diplomatic representatives of Germany and the Soviet Union are meeting even as we speak... Your string of victories here, and in the west, are unparalleled.... You are to return home to a grateful nation.

intro: Ah, Herr General, I hope you have enjoyed your leave.  As you know, British and Commonwealth  troops have occupied the historic pass at Thermopylae.  You must secure this pass and prevent the escape of the enemy.  The terrain is rugged and difficult for maneuver.   You must act decisively. These troops were bypassed in our initial Grecian campaign, but now is the time to eliminate this threat to our control of the area.

briliant.text: The English have surrendered, and Greek resistance has collapsed.  Your performance has been excellent, and we will continue to rely on your expertise.  Well done!  After some well-earned rest and recuperation you and your men will be returned to the Russian front to play a key role in our 1942 spring campaign.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: The English have surrendered, and Greek resistance has collapsed.  This was primarily due to the brilliant tactics of General Cundarian.  Your performance was mediocre, far below your past record. You will be given another chance.  After some rest and recuperation you and your men will be returned to the Russian front to play a key role in our 1942 spring campaign.

victory.text: The English have surrendered, and Greek resistance has collapsed.  Your performance has been excellent, and we will continue to rely on your expertise.  Well done!  After some well-earned rest and recuperation you and your men will be returned to the Russian front to play a key role in our 1942 spring campaign.

intro: Ah, Good day, Herr General!  Please sit down and allow me to explain the present situation.  As you know, our capture of Moscow was short-lived, because fresh Bolshevik troops from Siberia forced our weary troops to evacuate the city.  This spring we have decided to pursue a Southern strategy, capturing Stalingrad to serve as a base for further advances towards either Moscow or the Baku oil fields.  As part of this campaign you are directed to cross the Dnieper.

briliant.text: My commendations, Herr General!  Under harsh conditions, you have done very well.  A complete victory!  As a necessary prelude to our drive towards the key communications and industrial center of Stalingrad you are to reduce the fortified port of Sevastopol.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: My commendations, Herr General!  Under harsh conditions, you have done very well.  A complete victory!  As a necessary prelude to our drive towards the key communications and industrial center of Stalingrad you are to reduce the fortified port of Sevastopol.

intro: We cannot leave Sevastopol on our flank while we advance on Stalingrad and the Caucaus, therefore it must be taken. Sevastopol is the most heavily fortified area in the world, stronger than the Maginot line or even Gibraltar!  This will not be an easy task, Herr General, but the General Staff has confidence in your leadership and resourcefulness.

briliant.text: Excellent work, Herr General.  With Sevastopol in our hands our advances on Stalingrad and the Caucaus can proceed.  Your success here has led the General Staff to give you the critical assignment of taking Stalingrad, while Feldmarschall Manstein will conquer the Caucaus.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Excellent work, Herr General.  With Sevastopol in our hands our advances on Stalingrad and the Caucaus can proceed.  Your success here has led the General Staff to give you the critical assignment of taking Stalingrad, while Feldmarschall Manstein will conquer the Caucaus.

intro:
Now that Sevastopol has fallen our next objective is Stalingrad. This is an important road and railroad nexus. Also capture of a city named after the Bolshevik dictator will hurt their morale. This is a critical assignment, Herr General, you must take Stalingrad quickly.

[Confidential Update] Our campaign in Afrika has been halted. Feldmarschall Rommel's serious illness required his evacuation to the Fatherland for treatment. He is recovering but will not be able to return to Afrika for some time. Meanwhile his successors have been unable to continue his advance on the Suez Canal. The continuous loss of convoys to Allied air strikes has undoubtedly contributed to this loss of initiative.

briliant.text: Good work, Herr General.  With Stalingrad in our hands we can now choose our next move.  Intelligence indicates that the Western Allies are planning a landing in Northwest Afrika.  The General Staff has decided to send significant reinforcements to the Afrika Corps, so you and your men are to transfer to Afrika after a thorough rest and refitting.  Meanwhile Feldmarschall von Paulus's Sixth Army will take your place in Stalingrad.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Good work, Herr General.  With Stalingrad in our hands we can now choose our next move.  Intelligence indicates that the Western Allies are planning a landing in Northwest Afrika.  The General Staff has decided to send significant reinforcements to the Afrika Corps, so you and your men are to transfer to Afrika after a thorough rest and refitting.  Meanwhile Feldmarschall von Paulus's Sixth Army will take your place in Stalingrad.

intro:
Herr General, as you know the Americans landed in Northwest Afrika in November. While Feldmarschall Rommell executed a fighting withdrawal against the British, though outnumbered 10 to 1, the American drive from the west has had little resistance. It is imperative that the Allied drives be stopped. You must help Feldmarschall Rommel defeat the Allies.
The High Command agreed reluctantly to your demand that all arrangements for the transportation of your troops to Tunesia be handled by direct courier, never by radio. Our Enigma codes are unbreakable of course, but since Feldmarschall Rommel supported you in this we agreed. It is undoubtedly only coincidence that the convoy carrying you and your troops had no Allied interference.

briliant.text: Very well done, Herr General.  The Allied drive into Tunesia has been stopped.  Your counterattack has thrown them out of Tunesia and sent them reeling in disarray.  This gives us the opportunity to drive the Allies completely out of Northwest Afrika.  Because of your excellent record the General Staff has decided that this critical assigment is yours!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Very well done, Herr General.  The Allied drive into Tunesia has been stopped.  Your counterattack has thrown them out of Tunesia and sent them reeling in disarray.  This gives us the opportunity to drive the Allies completely out of Northwest Afrika.  Because of your excellent record the General Staff has decided that this critical assigment is yours!

intro: The Allies have been thrown out of Tunesia and are reeling in disarray from the bold strokes you and your brave men have delivered.  Now you must continue this drive and force them to evacuate their main base and supply port in Algieria, thus removing this threat to Feldmarschall Rommel's campaign to capture Egypt and the Suez Kanal.

briliant.text: Very well done, Herr General.  The Allies have been thrown out of Northwest Afrika.  We can now provide additional men and material to Feldmarschall Rommel in his drive on Egypt and the Suez Kanel.  Because of your excellent work in Tunesia and Algeria the General Staff has decided that you and your men are the logical choice to reinforce Feldmarschall Rommel.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Very well done, Herr General.  The Allies have been thrown out of Northwest Afrika.  We can now provide additional men and material to Feldmarschall Rommel in his drive on Egypt and the Suez Kanel.  Because of your excellent work in Tunesia and Algeria the General Staff has decided that you and your men are the logical choice to reinforce Feldmarschall Rommel.

intro: With the Allies forced out of Northwest Afrika we can now concentrate on taking Egypt and the Suez Kanal. Our immediate objective is to capture Bardia. The English have had time to reinforce and dig in, so this will not be an easy assignment, but it is critical. You must achieve your objectives quickly so we may maintain our pressure on the British.

briliant.text: Another superb tactical performance, Herr General. The British were reinforced and dug in, but you quickly overwhelmed them! Now we must move rapidly to take El Alamein as preparation for our conquest of Egypt and the Suez Kanal. You will be Feldmarschall Rommel's lead commander in this attack!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: A marginal performance, Herr General. The British were reinforced and dug in, but you should have overwhelmed them! At least you held the British in position so that Fieldmarschall Rommel could sweep around them and take our objectives. You are to be transferred back to the Russian front.

victory.text: Another superb tactical performance, Herr General. The British were reinforced and dug in, but you quickly overwhelmed them! Now we must move rapidly to take El Alamein as preparation for our conquest of Egypt and the Suez Kanal. You will be Feldmarschall Rommel's lead commander in this attack!

intro: Now that we have captured Bardia our next objective is El Alamein as the gateway to Egypt. The British are present in great strength, but your past performance indicates that you should be able to overcome them. Again, you must achieve your objectives quickly so we that may maintain our pressure on the British. You are Feldmarschall Rommel's lead commander in this attack!

briliant.text: Outstanding performance, Herr General.  But things are not going well in Russia. Feldmarschall Paulus has been unable to break out of Stalingrad.  Worse, intelligence indicates that the Bolsheviks are planning a great offensive in the Kursk region.  Therefore we must quickly take Alexandria so that Egypt and the Suez Canal can be conquered.  You are given a key role in the capture of Alexandria.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: A barely acceptable performance, Herr General. Only the brilliant maneuvers of Fieldmarschall Rommel saved the situation. He will now continue with the conquest of Egypt and the Suez Kanal. You and your men are to be transferred back to the Russian front, where things have not gone well. Fieldmarschall Paulus has been unable to break out of Stalingrad. Worse, intelligence indicates that the Bolsheviks are planning a great offensive in the Kursk region. The General Staff hopes that your failure at El Alamein was but a temporary departure from your previous excellent conduct and thus is giving you one more chance to prove yourself.

victory.text: Outstanding performance, Herr General.  But things are not going well in Russia. Feldmarschall Paulus has been unable to break out of Stalingrad.  Worse, intelligence indicates that the Bolsheviks are planning a great offensive in the Kursk region.  Therefore we must quickly take Alexandria so that Egypt and the Suez Canal can be conquered.  You are given a key role in the capture of Alexandria.

intro: Our objective is Alexandria, the great port of Egypt. With Alexandria in our possession supply will cease to be a problem. The British are present in great strength and strongly entrenched, but your past performance indicates that you should be able to overcome them. They will be supported by the remnants of the British armor, and resupplied British aviation. The Russians have begun a major offensive in the Kursk region so you must achieve your objectives quickly.

briliant.text: Excellent performance, Herr General. The conquest of Cairo and the Suez Kanal should now be easy, especially for Feldmarschall Rommel. Since the Bolsheviks have begun a great offensive in the Kursk region, while Feldmarschall Paulus is still unable to break out of Stalingrad, the General Staff has decided that you and your men are to be transferred back to the Russian front where you have performed so well in the past.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Excellent performance, Herr General. The conquest of Cairo and the Suez Kanal should now be easy, especially for Feldmarschall Rommel. Since the Bolsheviks have begun a great offensive in the Kursk region, while Feldmarschall Paulus is still unable to break out of Stalingrad, the General Staff has decided that you and your men are to be transferred back to the Russian front where you have performed so well in the past.

intro: Herr General, as you know the Kursk Salient poses a serious threat to us. To reduce this salient and restore the integrity of our line, we will attack from the north and south, pocket, and then crush the enemy trapped inside. You and your command will lead the northern thrust of our offensive. You must penetrate as far as the town of Prokhorovka. Good Luck.

briliant.text: You have dealt the Red Army a severe blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer some troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Good work, Herr General.  Meanwhile the Finns are opening a drive to recover the land they lost to the Bolsheviks in 1940.  Remembering your help in 1939 the Finns have specifically asked for you to lead their drive.  The General Staff has agreed to their request, so you and your men are to transfer North after a short period for rest and refitting.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: You have dealt the Red Army a severe blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer some troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Good work, Herr General.

victory.text: You have dealt the Red Army a severe blow. With our line shortened, we will be able to transfer some troops to Feldmarschall von Paulus at Stalingrad. Good work, Herr General.  Meanwhile the Finns are opening a drive to recover the land they lost to the Bolsheviks in 1940.  Remembering your help in 1939 the Finns have specifically asked for you to lead their drive.  The General Staff has agreed to their request, so you and your men are to transfer North after a short period for rest and refitting.

intro: Herr General. Our Finnish allies wish to reclaim the territory they lost to the Bolsheviks in 1940. You and your brave men will assist them in this, thus preparing the way for the seizure of Leningrad. Your offensive here will also divert some of the Bolshevik's attention from Feldmarschall Manstein's Army Group Center.

briliant.text: Congratulations! Brilliant performance, Herr General. The Finns have reclaimed their lost territory and will assist us in the future capture of Leningrad.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Congratulations! Brilliant performance, Herr General. The Finns have reclaimed their lost territory and will assist us in the future capture of Leningrad.

intro: With von Paulus's breakout from Stalingrad in conjunction with the offensive of Manstein's Army Group Center the Bolshevik's are retreating in Central Russia. Now with the Finn's recovery of their lost territory we have the opportunity to take Leningrad. You are given this task, do not fail.

briliant.text: Excellent performance, Herr General. Leningrad is ours! Now we must strike quickly towards Moscow while we have the initiative over the Bolsheviks.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Excellent performance, Herr General. Leningrad is ours! Now we must strike quickly towards Moscow while we have the initiative over the Bolsheviks.

intro: Herr General, the British on Crete have been a hindrance to our operations in the eastern Mediteranian. The General staff has decided to eliminate this annoyance. Since your troops are already in Greece, and our 1942 Russian campaign will wait for good spring weather, you have been chosen to lead this operation.

briliant.text: Excellent work, Herr General! Crete is ours, except for a few scattered units which may be left to our Italian allies. You and your men will rest and refit in preparation for our 1942 Russian campaign.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Excellent work, Herr General! Crete is ours, except for a few scattered units which may be left to our Italian allies. You and your men will rest and refit in preparation for our 1942 Russian campaign.

intro: Herr General.  Your brilliant leadership has brought us once again to Moscow.  This time we must capture the enemy capital and principal city and force the Bolsheviks to make peace on our terms.  The General Staff has given you this critical task, do not fail!

briliant.text: Herr General.  Your capture of Moscow once again showed your mastery of tactics.  The Bolsheviks still refuse to surrender but have offered us an armistice.  Our intelligence indicates that the Allies are planning an invasion of Europe early this summer.  Therefore the High Command signed the armistice with the Bolsheviks so we can prepare for the pending invasion.  You are to be transferred to the Western Front, where you will help defend Fortress Europe against an Allied invasion.

lose.text: General? Do you realise the results of your failed attack? We are far behind the schedule!

tactical.text: General? Do you realise the results of your failed attack? We are far behind the schedule! You had better not do something like this again. You are getting one last chance to redeem yourself, here in the south. Go!

victory.text: Herr General.  Your capture of Moscow once again showed your mastery of tactics.  The Bolsheviks still refuse to surrender but have offered us an armistice.  Our intelligence indicates that the Allies are planning an invasion of Europe early this summer.  Therefore the High Command signed the armistice with the Bolsheviks so we can prepare for the pending invasion.  You are to be transferred to the Western Front, where you will help defend Fortress Europe against an Allied invasion.

intro: Ja Wolfgang, I was as surprised as you that they chose Normandy.... Ah, Herr General, come in. Allow me to explain the present situation. We have a chance to drive the Allies back into the sea, here, near Caen. I will not pretend that this will be an easy task, but you have shown yourself to be a most resourceful fellow time and time again, ja? You will need all your skill to wrest a victory here. Our thoughts are with you. Ja, As I was saying, Wolfgang....

briliant.text: Excellent! Despite the fact the enemy have managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. It is unfortunate that we do not have more like you, Herr General.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Very good! Despite the fact the enemy has managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. You have done very well, Herr General.

victory.text: Very good! Despite the fact the enemy has managed to force their way inland at other points, you have swept all before you. And because of this blow you have dealt them, the Allies will not be able to take advantage of their successes elsewhere. You have done very well, Herr General.

intro: Herr General, as you know, the Allies are pushing inland from St. Lo in an attempt to break out from their beachhead in Normandy.  Your assignment is to stop this assault, then counterattack and force them back on Cherbourgh.  Success here is critical, as an Allied breakout could threaten the Reich!

briliant.text: Herr General, this victory is worthy of great praise. The Allies's attempted breakout has been stopped and now the only part of France they still hold is the area around Cherbourgh.  We must now take Cherbourgh and expel the Allies from Europe!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Herr General, this victory is worthy of great praise. The Allies's attempted breakout has been stopped and now the only part of France they still hold is the area around Cherbourgh.  We must now take Cherbourgh and expel the Allies from Europe!

intro: Well,  Herr General, you must quickly move on Cherbourgh and force the Allies from Europe. With Fortress Europe secure, and the Luftwaffe's success in dealing with Allied bombing raids, we will be able to build up our forces to invade England next year.

briliant.text: Brilliant work. You have fulfilled the General Staff's hopes!  Your drive to Cherbourgh has forced the last of the American and British forces from Europe.  Now we can concentrate on building up our forces to invade England next year.  You and your men will rest and refit for a key role in our invasion.  I am happy to inform you that you are promoted to Feldmarschall!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Brilliant work. You have fulfilled the General Staff's hopes!  Your drive to Cherbourgh has forced the last of the American and British forces from Europe.  Now we can concentrate on building up our forces to invade England next year.  You and your men will rest and refit for a key role in our invasion.  I am happy to inform you that you are promoted to Feldmarschall!

intro: Herr Feldmarschall, our drive to capture London has been stalled.  Far worse, while we were fighting in England the Bolsheviks stabbed us in the back!  They broke the armistice and with most of our troops tied up in England and Afrika have been able to rampage across Eastern Europe. We must end our English campaign swiftly, so we can respond to the Bolshevik's treachery.  You must quickly move on Windsor, a vital communications center.  With Windsor in our hands, London will be cut off from their industrial centers and be forced to surrender.  Good luck, Herr Feldmarschall.

briliant.text: Congratulations, Herr Feldmarschall.  London is ours!  Unfortunately, with only a few of our troops on the Continent the Bolsheviks have been able to drive across much of Eastern Europe. We must end our English campaign swiftly, so we can respond to the Bolshevik's treachery.  Therefore we must conquer the central region of England rapidly, so the English will have no choice but to sue for peace.  Speed is critical, Herr Feldmarschall.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Congratulations, Herr Feldmarschall.  London is ours!  Unfortunately, with only a few of our troops on the Continent the Bolsheviks have been able to drive across much of Eastern Europe. We must end our English campaign swiftly, so we can respond to the Bolshevik's treachery.  Therefore we must conquer the central region of England rapidly, so the English will have no choice but to sue for peace.  Speed is critical, Herr Feldmarschall.

intro:
Herr Feldmarschall, due to your unprecedented advance, we will soon see the triumphant finish of our English campaign. Feldmarschall von Manstein's Army Group North is within 20 kilometers of Glasgow, and ..... excuse me, Herr Feldmarschall .....
Herr Feldmarschall, I have just received information of the most critical importance. Intelligence reports indicate that the Americans are building a weapon of terrifying explosive power, which will be finished by August 1! It is imperative that we act decisively and conquer England before this weapon is ready. With England in our hands we can negotiate a reasonable peace with the Americans. Also we will then be able to transfer troops back to the East. The Bolsheviks are driving across Poland and our most skilled leaders have been able only to slow them!

briliant.text: Herr Feldmarschall, this triumph is a fitting end to our English campaign.  Once again your brilliant skill has led to victory, and more importantly, you have prevented the Americans from using their "Atomic Bomb."  England and the United States have agreed to an armistice!  But meanwhile with most of our troops tied up in England the Bolsheviks have been driving across Eastern Europe.  They are even threatening Berlin and Buda-Pest!  You and your brave men are to be transferred to Berlin as quickly as possible.  You must stop the Russian Bear!

lose.text: Herr General, German field commanders are not allowed to fail. Do you understand? I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Herr Feldmarschall, this triumph is a fitting end to our English campaign.  Once again your brilliant skill has led to victory, and more importantly, you have prevented the Americans from using their "Atomic Bomb."  England and the United States have agreed to an armistice!  But meanwhile with most of our troops tied up in England the Bolsheviks have been driving across Eastern Europe.  They are even threatening Berlin and Buda-Pest!  You and your brave men are to be transferred to Berlin as quickly as possible.  You must stop the Russian Bear!

intro: Herr Feldmarschall.  We have obtained an armistice with England and the United States.  Bravo!  But while we were conquering England the Bolsheviks treacherously broke our armistice with them and invaded our allied territories in Eastern Europe.  With the bulk of our forces in England and Afrika they have been able to pollute the sacred soil of the Fatherland and penetrate almost to Berlin!  You MUST stop them.

briliant.text:
Excellent work, Herr Feldmarschall. You have stopped the Bolsheviks and forced them back
across the Seelow Heights. Feldmarschall Manstein will now take command and continue
our drive to free all of the Fatherland from the Bolsheviks. Your superb tactical skills are
needed in Hungary where the situation is critical. The Bolsheviks have besieged Budapest,
and we believe that if it falls our Hungarian allies will sue for peace. You must relieve
Budapest.

lose.text: Herr General, German field commanders are not allowed to fail. Do you understand? I have nothing more to say to you.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text:
Excellent work, Herr Feldmarschall. You have stopped the Bolsheviks and forced them back
across the Seelow Heights. Feldmarschall Manstein will now take command and continue
our drive to free all of the Fatherland from the Bolsheviks. Your superb tactical skills are
needed in Hungary where the situation is critical. The Bolsheviks have besieged Budapest,
and we believe that if it falls our Hungarian allies will sue for peace. You must relieve
Budapest.

intro: Herr Feldmarschall, thank God you are here.  Our situation is critical. Buda-Pest is besieged by the Bolsheviks. Your troops must force their way into the city. It is doubtful that our Hungarian allies will continue to fight if Buda-Pest falls. If you can drive the Reds into the Danube, we may stop the Russian Bear from consuming us.

briliant.text: The Russians are dazed and reeling from the blows you and your brave men have delivered! Not only did you succeed in relieving Buda-Pest, you drove the Reds back across the Danube. The General Staff is amazed at your performance, Herr Feldmarschall.  Now we must continue to pursue the Bolsheviks.  This time we will not settle for an armistice.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. You have left us no choice but to come to terms with the Americans. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: The Russians are dazed and reeling from the blows you and your brave men have delivered! Not only did you succeed in relieving Buda-Pest, you drove the Reds back across the Danube. The General Staff is amazed at your performance, Herr Feldmarschall.  Now we must continue to pursue the Bolsheviks.  This time we will not settle for an armistice.

intro: Herr Feldmarschall, the Bosheviks are retreating everywhere! Feldmarschall Guderian has retaken the Baku oil fields, while Feldmarschall Manstein has surrounded Moscow.  As part of our campaign to keep the Bolsheviks on the run, you are to cross the Don river.

briliant.text: Very well done, Herr Feldmarschall!  The Bolsheviks are dazed and reeling from the blows you and your brave men have delivered.  You must continue to pursue them.

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. You have left us no choice but to come to terms with the Americans. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

tactical.text: Though our attack was well timed and resulted in complete surprise of the enemy, your performance was not of the highest caliber, Herr General.  Although you were successful, we expected more from you.

victory.text: Very well done, Herr Feldmarschall!  The Bolsheviks are dazed and reeling from the blows you and your brave men have delivered.  You must continue to pursue them.

intro: Our intelligence reports that the Bolshevik leader Stalin has fled Moscow and is reportedly barricaded in the city of Kazan.  Most of the remaining high-grade Bolshevik troops are also in the Kazan region.  Meanwhile Bolshevik troops elsewhere are beginning to surrender.  Herr Feldmarschall, a quick victory here, especially if you capture Stalin, should lead to the Bolshevik's surrender and end this war!

briliant.text:
A glorious victory, Herr Feldmarschall! The Bolsheviks have surrendered unconditionally! We will require the independence of Bylorussia and the Ukraine under German protection, which will stabilize our Eastern borders. We are about to sign a peace treaty with the English and Americans which will involve our withdrawal from England and France (we keep Alsace-Lorraine). Now we will have the peace necessary to develop the Fatherland to its full potential.
You are to return home to a grateful nation!

lose.text: Herr Feldmarshall, I am at a loss for words.  Your failure is...  incomprehensible. You have left us no choice but to come to terms with the Americans. This debacle will be remembered as one of the worst military disasters of our nation.  It is better for you that you will never return to the fatherland.  Much better.

We are about to sign a peace treaty with the English and Americans which will involve our withdrawal from England and France (we keep Alsace-Lorraine). Now we will have the peace necessary to develop the Fatherland to its full potential.
You are to return home to a grateful nation!

We will require the independence of Bylorussia and the Ukraine under German protection, which will stabilize our Eastern borders. We are about to sign a peace treaty with the English and Americans which will involve our withdrawal from England and France (we keep Alsace-Lorraine). Now we will have the peace necessary to develop the Fatherland to its full potential.
You are to return home to a grateful nation!
